document.docAuthor: Fu, Yue, Saether, Ole & Wang, Xinhua
document.masterDocTitle: Thienemanniella Kieffer from East Asia, with a systematic review of the genus (Diptera: Chironomidae: Orthocladiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Thienemanniella Kieffer from East Asia, with a systematic review of the genus (Diptera: Chironomidae: Orthocladiinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to known males of
Thienemanniella

paragraph.keyLead: - Eyes pubescent or hairy, antennal apex notched or slightly rounded ........................................................................... 7

4 . Antenna with 9 flagellomeres, inferior volsella rounded ..................................
T. togamijika
Sasa et Okazawa, 1992

- Antenna with 10 flagellomeres, inferior volsella hook-shaped .................................................
T. okigrata
Sasa, 1990
- Inferior volsella nearly triangular and along the inner margin of gonocoxite ............................................................. 6

8 . Superior volsella hook-shaped; transverse sternapodeme without oral projection; phallapodeme straight and short .. .......................................................................................................................................................
T. hainanensis
sp. n.

- Superior volsella triangular, transverse sternapodeme with oral projections; phallapodeme more or less curved and relatively long ............................................................................................................................................................... 9

9 . Antenna with 11 flagellomeres, AR 0.72–0.90 ; third palpomere with digitiform lobe .........
T. similis ( Malloch)
1915

- Antenna with 12 flagellomeres, AR 0.25–0.28 ; third palpomere without digitiform lobe....................
T. absens
sp. n.
10 . Inferior volsella narrow, digitiform to spatulate, sometimes with basal apodeme; or broad and low ........................ 11

11 . Superior volsella completely fused with the inner of gonocoxite ...........................
T. medialis
Sublette & Sasa, 1994
- Superior volsella present, well developed or partly fused with the inner of gonocoxite............................................ 12
12 . Inferior volsella digitiform with an apodeme, bare, phallapodeme straight ............................................................... 13
– Inferior volsella not digitiform, most often carrying thin glandular setae, phallapodeme curved ............................. 14

13 . Superior volsella with a flat rim along the gonocoxite narrowly and completely fused
.. T. antennata
Freeman, 1953

- Superior volsella mostly triangular and fused only anteriomedially ............
T. lobapodema
Hestenes & Saether, 2000
- Gonocoxite without such concavity for gonostylus, tergite IX without many long setae .......................................... 17

17 . Antenna with 8 flagellomeres; tergite IX with a small, flexible, triangular hump-like extension; apex of phallapo- deme bent 90 ° caudally. ............................................................................................................
T. fuga
Lehmann, 1979

18 . Antenna with 9 flagellomeres; gonostylus expanded; superior volsella more or less digitiform and projecting........... ......................................................................................................................................
T. nagaramaculata
Sasa, 1989
- Antenna with 10 flagellomeres; gonostylus not expanded; superior volsella narrow and not projecting .................. 19
- Superior volsella partly overlapping or joined with inferior volsella......................................................................... 33

21 . Inferior volsella bare, with apodeme; transverse sternapodeme narrow and very thin, without oral projection............ ......................................................................................................................................
T. trivittata
Goetghebuer, 1935
- Inferior volsella high and placed basally or medially on gonocoxite ......................................................................... 30

23 . Third palpomere with small apical projection; gonostylus with 2 megasetae
T. taurocapita
Hestenes & Saether, 2000
– Third palpomere without small apical projection; gonostylus with 1 megaseta......................................................... 24
24 . Superior volsella large, triangular and close to inferior volsella, conspicuously projecting ..................................... 25
- Superior volsella small, triangular or narrow and at a distance from inferior volsella, not projecting ...................... 27
- AR about 0.50 ; inferior volsella caudally hooked, posterior margin of superior volsella oblique............................. 26

- Tergite IX not partly semitransparent; phallapodeme distinctly curved distinctly; gonostylus equally wide to apex .. .....................................................................................................................
T. oyabedilata
Sasa, Kawai et Ueno, 1988
- Trochanters without keel or only fore trochanter with dorsal keel............................................................................. 28

28 . Superior volsella joined medially; inferior volsella largely typical triangular ...................................
T. sichuana
sp. n.
- Superior volsella separate medially; inferior volsella not largely triangular.............................................................. 29

- Posterior of inferior volsella rounded; tergite IX partly semitransparent...............................
T. spreta (
Roback, 1962
)

31 . Antenna with 10 flagellomeres; superior volsella conspicuously projecting ........
T. boltoni
Hestenes & Saether, 2000

- Antenna with 12–13 flagellomeres; superior volsella not projecting ..................................
T. minuscule
Brundin 1949

- Superior volsella narrow and not projecting; phallapodeme with projection for joint with sternapodeme placed pre- lateral .................................................................................................................................................
T. triangula
sp. n.
33 . Antenna with 10 flagellomeres, apical part of superior volsella hooked.................................................................... 34
– Antenna with 11–13 flagellomeres, apical part of superior volsella rounded or flat.................................................. 35

37 . Third palpomere with small apical projection; phallapodeme expanded medially, superior volsella nearly rectangular ..........................................................................................................
T. tiunovae
Makarchenko et Makarchenko 2006

38 . Superior volsella separated medially, triangular, apical part nearly right-angled
T. tonewquerea
Sasa et Tanaka, 2002
- Superior volsella joined medially, rounded or narrowed, apical part with rounded corner........................................ 39

40 . AR 0.30–0.37 ; superior volsella small and not projecting; phallapodeme long and strongly curved; apex of gonosty- lus straight .........................................................................................................................
T. clavicornis
Kieffer, 1911

- AR 0.60–0.76 ; superior volsella large and projecting; phallapodeme short and slightly curved; apex of gonostylus slightly hooked .....................................................................................................................
T. obscura
Brundin, 1947
42 . Anal vein of wing surpassing cubital fork; inferior volsella almost flat posteriorly .................................................. 43
- Anal vein of wing not reaching cubital fork; inferior volsella slightly oblique posteriorly ...................................... 44

43 . Antenna with 13 flagellomeres; AR more than 0.50 .........................................................
T. acuticornis
Kieffer, 1912

- Antenna with 12 flagellomeres; AR 0.30 ...................................................
T. ogasaquardecima
Sasa et Suzuki, 1997

44 . Ultimate flagellomere of antenna longer than combined length of preceding eight flagellomeres; AR about 0.85 ...... ........................................................................................................................................
T. majuscula (
Edwards, 1924
)

45 . Body color very pale, AR more than 0.60 ............................................................
T. gotopallida Sasa et Suzuki, 2000

46 . Fore trochanter with keel, inferior volsella angle-like near apex ..............................................
T. xena (
Roback, 1957
)

- Fore trochanter without keel, inferior volsella rounded near apex .......................................
T. vittata (
Edwards, 1924
)
